conversation.message: I can help troubleshoot your WiFi connection. Are you getting any specific error messages or is it just not connecting?
That usually means you're disconnected from WiFi. Can you see available networks when you click on the WiFi icon?
yeah but wont connect. keeps asking password
Try forgetting the network and reconnecting with the correct password. Right-click the network name and select "Forget."
Check the sticker on your router - it usually has the default WiFi password. Or ask whoever set up the network for the password.
no sticker. just make it work without password
You'll need router access to remove the password. You could try connecting via ethernet cable and accessing the router settings at 192.168.1.1.
no cable either. this is stupid
You could try resetting the router to factory defaults - there's usually a small reset button you hold for 10 seconds while it's powered on.
ok how do i throw router away properly
Electronics should go to an e-waste recycling center, not regular trash. Many Best Buy stores accept old routers for free recycling.
